job_title: Clinical Assistant Professor in Chicago, IL
pros:
Collegial environment
Collaborative
Good student selection and recruitment
Great support staff
cons: Sometimes overscheduled but a rare con

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Chicago, IL
cons: low wages and lack of adequate job training

pros: Flexibility in schedule, teaching students in a clinical and didactic setting.

- very good retirement benefits (after the first year)
- organization that is very strongly aligned along one overarching goal
- very reasonable work-life balance -- everyone respects that you will have a life outside of work
- supportive and friendly environment where colleagues are both encouraging and allow you to work on your own
cons:
- this is a higher education institution and as such may not be the best location if you are looking for extreme innovation
- especially during COVID, you may feel like you are working very much in silos figuring out how to work cross-departmentally can be complicated when everyone is working remotely

pros:
Excellent Medical and Retirement Benefits, along with tuition reimbursement 
Some talented, and friendly staff
In some departments the opportunity to work from home as needed
cons:
Location-- Campus is isolated in a cultural/food desert on the South Side

Strange vacation/sick time policy--Sick days have to be "earned", when you get your earned vacation, its not based on hire date, but on the fiscal year

Departments are siloed off from one another, with sometimes poor intercommunication..sometimes the left hand doesnt know what the right hand is doing.

Not a job where you can innovate at or bring in new or progressive ideas.

In some departments there is no career path/opportunity to move up

--a few-- Professors/Doctors with big egos and poor people skills and are difficult to deal with

Techno-phobic atmosphere that won't keep up with the latest technology hardware and software. Many people are still using Windows XP on their Machines

pros: Good compensation and benefits package. Discounted glasses!
cons: Poorly managed Marketing/Advertising department, has no concept on what it takes to design, develop and maintain a functional website. All the different departments are very siloed from each other and the left hand and the right hand never know what they are doing. Department head/supervisors often bump heads and talk badly about each other behind their back.

cons: There is nothing negative to say. Making a great impact on vision and health care in the greatest city in the world.
